attributes.comment:
It seems that this change is an attempt to have someone pay for the cost of
granting political asylumn - that someone is the adoptive parents who are pursuing
international adoptions.

Would it not be more fair to have a budget line for this cost - political asylumn -
rather then passing the cost on to those who are not even involved in this process?

As an adoptive parent myself I understand government cannot always be right but
they can adhere to fair practices in attempting to balance cost and service to the
nation. Adoption is expensive enough already, and it is unconscionable to raise
fees by up to 66% for adoption-related petitions in order to pay for other programs.

I would ask that the Immigration Service look at other means to pay for political
asylumn costs and not do so by penalizing financially

Comment on FR Doc # E7-01631
